text: Azhari (Arabic أزهري) or with the article -al as in al-Azhari (Arabic الأزهري, literally belonging to Azhar) is a common surname. It may refer to: ==Azhari== *Aidul Fitriciada Azhari, Indonesian judicial administrator *Akhtar Raza Khan Azhari (1943–2018), also knowm as Tajushshari'ah or Azhari Miya, an Indian Barelvi Muslim scholar *Ayu Azhari (born 1967), Indonesian actress and author *Che Husna Azhari (born 1955), Malaysian writer of literature *Gholam Reza Azhari (1912–2001), Iranian military leader and Prime Minister of Iran *Khaled Azhari (born 1966), Egyptian politician and government minister *Mizanur Rahman Azhari, Bengali Muslim speaker, scholar and preacher *Sarah Azhari (born 1978), Indonesian actress, model and singer *Yasmina Azhari, Syrian businesswoman ==Al-Azhari== *Abu Mansur al-Azhari (895–980) *Abdullah Quraishi Al-Azhari (1935–2015), Indian Islamic scholar *Ahmed Saad Al-Azhari, Egyptian born, British Islamic scholar, and is the founder of the Ihsan Institute *Ismail al-Azhari (1900–1969), Sudanese nationalist and political figure *Muhammad Karam Shah al-Azhari (1918–1998), Pakistani Islamic scholar associated with Barelvi movement ==See also == *Azhar (name)
title: Azhari (name)
